StatisticsCntrNumOfBitsType.name: StatisticsCntrNumOfBitsType
StatisticsCntrNumOfBitsType.description: The counter can be of different sizes - 32 bit, 48 bit, 64 bit. Maximum is 64.

StatisticsClearActionType.name: StatisticsClearActionType
StatisticsClearActionType.description: Clear action, value for clear scalar.

StatisticsCntrType.name: StatisticsCntrType
StatisticsCntrType.description: The counter can be of different types, depends on actions adhered to rules that the counter is working on.

rlPolicy.name: rlPolicy

revisions.description: Initial V2 version of this MIB.

Added rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseVPTId and rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseEtherTypeId To rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsTable Added rlPolicyClassifierVPTID And rlPolicyClassifierEtherTypeID To rlPolicyClassifierTable Added Vpt and Ethertype support to rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaSupported Added rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseInnerVlanId To rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsTable Added rlPolicyClassifierInnerVID To rlPolicyClassifierTable Added Inner vlan id support to rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaSupported
Add to RlPolicyQosMode service ,Add rlPolicyRulesDownloadMarker,Added rlPolicyDscpVptTable .

rlPolicy.description: The private MIB module definition generic traffic policy in Radlan devices.

RlPolicyGroupType.name: RlPolicyGroupType
RlPolicyGroupType.description: Specifies one of 3 classifier types for which offset bytes can be specified. For Ip and Ipx, the offsets indicated are relative to the beginning of the L3 data (IP options field is skipped). For the Bridged type, the offsets are relative to L2 (and any 802.1D tag is skipped). A value of notUsed is applied, if the classifier uses one set of offsets for bridge, IP and IPX

RlPolicyClassifierDiffservIfType.name: RlPolicyClassifierDiffservIfType
RlPolicyClassifierDiffservIfType.description: Specifies port's type to which a classifier is applied. It is only used for the DiffServ mode. For the non-DiffServ mode the normal value may be used.

RlPolicyTrustTypes.name: RlPolicyTrustTypes
RlPolicyTrustTypes.description: Configure the port trust state cos - Classifies ingress packets with the packet CoS values. For untagged packets, the port default CoS is used. dscp - Classifies ingress packets with the packet DSCP values. For non-ip tagged packets, the packet CoS value is used with the Cos-to-DSCP table .For non-IP untagged packets, the default port CoS is used with the Cos-to-DSCP table tcp-udp - v750 deprecated. port to dscp - Classifies ingress packets with the packet destination port values. For non-ip tagged packets, the packet CoS value is used with the Cos-to-DSCP table. For non-IP untagged packets, the default port CoS is used with the Cos-to-DSCP table. none - v750 deprecated. 802.1p is disabled for this port and the packet gets best effort queue. cos-dscp- Classifies ingress packets with the packet DSCP values. For non-ip tagged packets, the packet CoS value is used with the Cos-to-Queue table .For non-IP untagged packets, the default port CoS is used with the Cos-to-Queue table

RlPolicyQosMode.name: RlPolicyQosMode
RlPolicyQosMode.description: The user can set the system to operate either in the Basic mode or in the Advanced mode. The setting of the mode applies to all ports in the system. configuring the system to work in the advanced mode, all setting for the basic mode are not in affect. For example, 802.1p is not available when operating in the advanced mode. When changing from basic mode to advanced mode and then back to basic mode, the user assignments in the basic mode are restored. Same for moving from advanced to basic and back again to advanced mode, here again the user assignments are kept. The different modes are mutually exclusive, i.e., only one can be active at a given time. For example, when configuring the system to work in the advanced mode, all setting for the basic mode are not in affect. This means that 802.1p is not available when operating in the advanced mode. When changing between modes (Basic, Advanced, Service, none), some of the user settings are reset to their default values. Specifically: 1. When changing from the advanced mode to any other mode, the CCL definitions are lost. 2. When changing from any mode to any other mode, the interface assignments: associated Policy map, trust mode of the Basic mode, shaper and scheduler settings are lost. 3. When changing from service mode to any other mode, all service mode settings are lost. 4. When changing to service mode, ACL are lost. The user is prompted if he wants to whether to import his active ACLs to the service mode. 5. All other user configurations are kept. When the system is configured to the Basic mode and the user changes the trust mode, the CCL assignment per port and the shaper settings are reset to their default values.

L4ProtType.name: L4ProtType
L4ProtType.description: specify to Layer 4 protocol type for which the port number will refer at the rlPolicyTcpUdpPortDscpTable.

RlPolicyTimeBasedAclWeekPeriodicList.name: RlPolicyTimeBasedAclWeekPeriodicList
RlPolicyTimeBasedAclWeekPeriodicList.description: Bitmap that includes days of week. Each bit in the bitmap associated with corresponding day of the week.

RlPolicyMarkVlanAction.name: RlPolicyMarkVlanAction
RlPolicyMarkVlanAction.description: Specifies the mark vlan action type in the class map table. 1 - noMark - No vlan marking 2 - mark - mark vlan tagged. 3 - markNestedVlan - add vlan tag to the packet.

RlPolicyRedirectAction.name: RlPolicyRedirectAction
RlPolicyRedirectAction.description: Specifies the packet redirection options. Redirection is applied only on permitted packets. 1 - disabled - no redirect 2 - trap - trap to local_host (CPU) 3 - redirectToInterface - redirect to a output interface (port, trunk or vlan) 4 - redirectToAllPorts - redirect to all ports, exept the ingress port. 5 - mirror - forward the packet and sent a copy to local_host (CPU) 6 - analyzerPort - forward the packet and sent a copy to egress port. 7 - loopback - redirect the packet the the port it was recieved. 8 - redirectToPortGroup - send to group of ports, defined in rlUserAssignedVidxTable table. 9 - mirror_and_redirectToInterface - send the packet to interface and send a copy to local_host(CPU) 10 -mirror_and_redirectToInterfacesGroup - send the packet to group of ports and send a copy to local_host(CPU)

rlPolicyMibVersion.name: rlPolicyMibVersion
rlPolicyMibVersion.description: MIB's version, the current version is 14 1 - original version 2 - two new fields rlPolicyActionChangeDscpNonConform rlPolicyActionNewDscpNonConform were added. 3 - added support new policy features QoS modes: basic and advanced support for trusted mode operations mapping tables for trusted ports dscp, tcpUdp, mutation, remarking. 4 - I) added support to service mode. II)DSCP to VPT mapping table III) download marker 5 - Added cos-Dscp to RlPolicyTrustTypes 6 - Added rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseVPTId and rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseEtherTypeId To rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsTable Added rlPolicyClassifierVPTID And rlPolicyClassifierEtherTypeID To rlPolicyClassifierTable Added Vpt and Ethertype support to rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaSupported 7 - Added rlPolicyPortCfgPortRateLimitStatus,rlPolicyPortCfgCirPortRateLimit rlPolicyPortCfgCbsPortRateLimit to rlPolicyPortConfigurationTable 8 - Added rlPolicyDefaultForwardingProtocol to rlPolicyDefaultForwardingTable Added rlPolicyDscpToDpTable 9 - Add statistics 10 - Add classifier utilization 11 -Added rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseInnerVlanId To rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsTable Added rlPolicyClassifierInnerVID To rlPolicyClassifierTable Added Inner vlan id support to rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaSupported 12 - Added rlPolicyVlanConfigurationTable 13 - Added rlPolicyIsTCAvailable scalar 14 - Added rlPolicyCPUSafeGuardEnable

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupSc.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupScheme
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupSc.description: Some platforms allow Policy statements to examine all packet offsets(Opal); other platforms require specification of specific byte offsets for routedIp packets, another set of offsets for routedIpx, a third set for bridge.

rlPolicyNumberOfOffsetsPerFlowClassifica.name: rlPolicyNumberOfOffsetsPerFlowClassificationOffsetGroup
rlPolicyNumberOfOffsetsPerFlowClassifica.description: For platforms which require an FCOG, indicates the maximum number of byte offsets specifiable for each offset group.

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetGroupMax.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetGroupMaximumOffset
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetGroupMax.description: Indicates the maximum value of a byte offset in a Flow Classification Offset Group. If 0, there is no limit.

rlPolicyNumberOfOffsetsPerOmpcGroup.name: rlPolicyNumberOfOffsetsPerOmpcGroup
rlPolicyNumberOfOffsetsPerOmpcGroup.description: indicates the maximum number of byte offsets specifiable for each Ompc offset group.

rlPolicyOmpcMaximumOffset.name: rlPolicyOmpcMaximumOffset
rlPolicyOmpcMaximumOffset.description: Indicates the maximum value of a byte offset in a Ompc Group. If 0, there is no limit.

rlPolicyOMPCPermittedOperators.name: rlPolicyOMPCPermittedOperators
rlPolicyOMPCPermittedOperators.description: A bit mask indicating which operators are permissable in an OMPC: ---------- |87654321| ---------- 1 - equal operator permitted 2 - not-equal operator permitted 3 - greater-than operator permitted 4 - less-than operator permitted

rlPolicyMaxOMPCLengthForBiggerSmallerOpe.name: rlPolicyMaxOMPCLengthForBiggerSmallerOperation
rlPolicyMaxOMPCLengthForBiggerSmallerOpe.description: Indicates the maximal permissible length of an OMPC using bigger' or 'smaller' condition. If 0, there is no limit.

rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaSupp.name: rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaSupported
rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaSupp.description: A bit mask indicating which additional Criteria may be supported by the classifier: ---------- |87654321| ---------- 1 - input port supported 2 - output port supported 3 - VLAN ID for bridging supported 4 - VPT ID for bridging supported 5 - EtherType ID for bridging supported 6 - Inner VLAN ID for bridging supported

rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaUsed.name: rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaUsedInOffsetCount
rlPolicyClassifierAdditionalCriteriaUsed.description: Indicates whether the additional FCOG or Classifier criteria (ie. inPort, outPort VID count towards the maximum number of offsets ie. whether using inPort in the FCOG reduces the maximum number of offsets available.

rlPolicyClassifierPermittedOffsetTypes.name: rlPolicyClassifierPermittedOffsetTypes
rlPolicyClassifierPermittedOffsetTypes.description: A bit mask indicating which offset types are supported by the platform for FCOG and OMPC definitions: ---------- |87654321| ---------- 1 - L2 offsets supported 2 - L3 offsets supported

rlPolicyClassifierOMPCActions.name: rlPolicyClassifierOMPCActions
rlPolicyClassifierOMPCActions.description: A bit mask indicating which operation could be performed with OPMC ---------- |87654321| ---------- 1 - equal, 2 - notEqual, 3 - bigger, 4 - smaller.

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsTable.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsTable
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsTable.description: Specifies the byte offsets that the platform can use for policy decisions. This table is used for platforms which impose limitations on choosing the OMPCs for classification. If the platform does not impose any limitations, the value of rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupScheme is allOffsetsPermitted. Each entry in the table specifies a combination of byte offsets which can be used to specify flow classification. A rule may use a subset of the bytes of its Offset Group. The maximum value for each offset is given by rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetGroupMaximumOffset. The maximum number of offsets per Offset Group is given by rlPolicyNumberOfOffsetsPerFlowClassificationOffsetGroup.

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupEn.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupEntry
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupEn.description: The flow classification offset table entry includes the following parameters

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupTy.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupType
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupTy.description: Specifies a classifier type for which offset bytes can be specified.

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupOf.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupOffset
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupOf.description: The list of offsets to be included in the Flow Classification Offset Group are specified as subidentifiers in the OID(after the first 2 bytes which must be 1.1). The maximal number of permissible offsets is given by rlPolicyNumberOfOffsetsPerFlowClassificationOffsetGroup. The maximal value that an offset can have is rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetGroupMaximumOffset.

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupOf.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupOffsetType
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupOf.description: Indicates whether the corresponding byte denotes an offset from beginning of L2, from the beginning of L3 IPv4 packet data or from the beginning of L3 IPv6 packet data. Each byte in the OID contains either: (1) - L2 offset (2) - L3 Offset (3) - L3 IPv6 Offset

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupMa.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupMask
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupMa.description: The list of masks corresponding to the offsets to be included in the Flow Classification Offset Group are specified as bytes in the OID(after the first 2 bytes which must be 1.1).

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseInputInterface
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.description: Indicates whether or not the Input Interface Index is usable in Policy Rule definitions.

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseOutputInterface
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.description: Indicates whether or not the Output Interface Index(ie. routing/bridging decision) is usable in Policy Rule definitions

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseVlanId
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.description: Indicates whether or not the VlanId is usable in Policy Rule definitions for bridged packets

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupSt.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupStatus
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupSt.description: The status of a table entry. It is used to delete an entry from this table.

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseVPTId
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.description: Indicates whether or not the VPT is usable in Policy Rule definitions for bridged packets

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseEtherTypeId
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.description: Indicates whether or not the EtherType is usable in Policy Rule definitions for bridged packets

rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.name: rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUseInnerVlanId
rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsGroupUs.description: Indicates whether or not the inner VlanId is usable in Policy Rule definitions for bridged packets

rlPolicyOMPCEntry.name: rlPolicyOMPCEntry
rlPolicyOMPCEntry.description: Each classification statement consists of the following parameters

rlPolicyOMPCGroupType.name: rlPolicyOMPCGroupType
rlPolicyOMPCGroupType.description: Specifies a classifier type for which offset bytes can be specified.

rlPolicyOMPCOffset.name: rlPolicyOMPCOffset
rlPolicyOMPCOffset.description: Specifies the offset within the frame (in bytes) from the layer according to rlPolicyGroupType. The limitation of this field is according to the rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetGroupMaximumOffset parameter if this OMPC is used by an entry in the rlPolicyClassifierTable whose rlPolicyClassifierType is a protocol for which predefined offsets in rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsTable are required. rlPolicyRequiredOffsetGroups indicates for which protocols there is such a requirement.

rlPolicyOMPCOffsetType.name: rlPolicyOMPCOffsetType
rlPolicyOMPCOffsetType.description: Indicates whether the offset should be interpreted as relative to the beginning of L2 or the beginning of L3

rlPolicyOMPCMask.name: rlPolicyOMPCMask
rlPolicyOMPCMask.description: Specifies which bits of the rlPolicyOMPCPattern field are significant for packet comparison. The length of the mask, in case of 'bigger' or 'smaller' rlPolicyOMPCCondition, is limited by rlPolicyMaxOMPCLengthForBiggerSmallerOperation.

rlPolicyOMPCPattern.name: rlPolicyOMPCPattern
rlPolicyOMPCPattern.description: Describes the mask field. The length of this object must be equal to the length of rlPolicyOMPCMask.

rlPolicyOMPCCondition.name: rlPolicyOMPCCondition
rlPolicyOMPCCondition.description: These define the operation carried out on the two 'operands' (frame and pattern), i.e. Bigger means that frame bits should be bigger than pattern bits. The permitted values are according to rlPolicyOMPCPermittedOperators parameter, if this OMPC is used by an entry in the rlPolicyClassifierTable whose rlPolicyClassifierType is a protocol for which predefined offsets in rlPolicyFlowClassificationOffsetsTable are required. rlPolicyRequiredOffsetGroups indicates for which protocols there is such a requirement.

rlPolicyOMPCDescription.name: rlPolicyOMPCDescription
rlPolicyOMPCDescription.description: Free text specifing the nature of this OMPC.

rlPolicyOMPCStatus.name: rlPolicyOMPCStatus
rlPolicyOMPCStatus.description: The status of a table entry. It is used to delete an entry from this table.

rlPolicyClassifierEntry.name: rlPolicyClassifierEntry
rlPolicyClassifierEntry.description: Classifiers can be of the ingress, egress, or post-routing phase varieties. Each multifield classification statement consists of the following parameters.

rlPolicyClassifierType.name: rlPolicyClassifierType
rlPolicyClassifierType.description: Specifies a classifier type for which offset bytes can be specified.

rlPolicyClassifierListIndex.name: rlPolicyClassifierListIndex
rlPolicyClassifierListIndex.description: List Index into the Classifier Table.

rlPolicyClassifierSubListIndex.name: rlPolicyClassifierSubListIndex
rlPolicyClassifierSubListIndex.description: SubList Index into the Classifier Table.

rlPolicyClassifierOmpcList.name: rlPolicyClassifierOmpcList
rlPolicyClassifierOmpcList.description: The list of OMPCs to check with this Classifier. Each subidentifier together with rlPolicyClassifierType specify one OMPC.

rlPolicyClassifierInIfIndex.name: rlPolicyClassifierInIfIndex
rlPolicyClassifierInIfIndex.description: Input interface index to be compared with received packet, a value of 0 denotes that the classifier is applied to all ports.

rlPolicyClassifierOutIfIndex.name: rlPolicyClassifierOutIfIndex
rlPolicyClassifierOutIfIndex.description: Output interface index to be compared with sent packet, a value of 0 denotes that the classifier is applied to all ports.

rlPolicyClassifierVID.name: rlPolicyClassifierVID
rlPolicyClassifierVID.description: VLAN ID, used only for bridged traffic.

rlPolicyClassifierDiffservInIfType.name: rlPolicyClassifierDiffservInIfType
rlPolicyClassifierDiffservInIfType.description: For a classifier used by the Diffserv Rules table. Enables specification of a classifier that should apply to all Diffserv boundary ports or all Diffserv Interior ports. If normal is specified, the rlPolicyClassifierInIfIndex field is used as it is in the non-diffserv case. If allBoundary or allInterior is selected, rlPolicyClassifierInIfIndex is ignored

rlPolicyClassifierDiffservOutIfType.name: rlPolicyClassifierDiffservOutIfType
rlPolicyClassifierDiffservOutIfType.description: For a classifier used by the Diffserv Rules table. Enables specification of a classifier that should apply to outbound traffic on all Diffserv boundary ports or all Diffserv Interior ports. If normal is specified, the rlPolicyClassifierOutIfIndex field is used as it is in the non-diffserv case. If allBoundary or allInterior is selected, rlPolicyClassifierOutIfIndex is ignored

rlPolicyClassifierStatus.name: rlPolicyClassifierStatus
rlPolicyClassifierStatus.description: The status of a table entry. It is used to delete an entry from this table.

rlPolicyClassifierInIfIndexList.name: rlPolicyClassifierInIfIndexList
rlPolicyClassifierInIfIndexList.description: allow to define list of ports for the specific classifier for ingress classification. if rlPolicyClassifierInIfIndex equal to zero then the following list should be reffered , if the list is empty we refer to ALL Ports

rlPolicyClassifierOutIfIndexList.name: rlPolicyClassifierOutIfIndexList
rlPolicyClassifierOutIfIndexList.description: allow to define list of ports for the specific classifier for egress classification. if rlPolicyClassifierOutIfIndex equal to zero then the following list should be reffered , if the list is empty we refer to ALL Ports

rlPolicyClassifierVPTID.name: rlPolicyClassifierVPTID
rlPolicyClassifierVPTID.description: VPT ID - user priority tag to be compared with . 8 is used to indicate not used value for this classifier

rlPolicyClassifierVPTIDMask.name: rlPolicyClassifierVPTIDMask
rlPolicyClassifierVPTIDMask.description: VPT ID Mask ,mask the user priority field . 0 is the default indicate Mask all compared with any VPT value

rlPolicyClassifierEtherTypeID.name: rlPolicyClassifierEtherTypeID
rlPolicyClassifierEtherTypeID.description: EtherType ID, to be compared with. 65535 is used to indicate not used value for this classifier 1499 is uded to indicate IPv4 ethertype that is originated from IPv4 ACL with permit/deny any any any 1500 is uded to indicate IPv6 ethertype that is originated from IPv6 ACL with permit/deny any any any

rlPolicyClassifierInnerVID.name: rlPolicyClassifierInnerVID
rlPolicyClassifierInnerVID.description: INNER VLAN ID, used only for double tagged traffic.

rlPolicyDroppedPacketCountSupported.name: rlPolicyDroppedPacketCountSupported
rlPolicyDroppedPacketCountSupported.description: Indicates whether the dropped packets counter in the rlPolicyRulesTable is supported.

rlPolicyFilterActionOptions.name: rlPolicyFilterActionOptions
rlPolicyFilterActionOptions.description: A bit mask indicating which operation could be perform ---------- |87654321| ---------- 1 - block, 2 - blockAndTrap, 3 - permitAndTrap, 4 - permit.

rlPolicyIngressMeteringSupported.name: rlPolicyIngressMeteringSupported
rlPolicyIngressMeteringSupported.description: Specifies whether the platform supports metering in inbound packet rules.

rlPolicyEgressMeteringSupported.name: rlPolicyEgressMeteringSupported
rlPolicyEgressMeteringSupported.description: Specifies whether the platform supports metering on outbound packet rules (for Diffserv).

rlPolicyRulesTable.name: rlPolicyRulesTable
rlPolicyRulesTable.description: The table of rules and Rules statements applied to all incoming traffic at the post-routing phase - ie. both the inPort and outPort are available for classification When Diffserv is not in effect(ie. IPX, bridging, or IP when the global option for Diffserv is off), certain table parameters are not available(see below). The DiffServ option is enabled or disabled by setting rlDiffservModeEnabled.

rlPolicyRulesEntry.name: rlPolicyRulesEntry
rlPolicyRulesEntry.description: Each multifield classification statement consists of the following parameters.

rlPolicyRulesTableType.name: rlPolicyRulesTableType
rlPolicyRulesTableType.description: Specifies a classifier type for which offset bytes can be specified.

rlPolicyRulesInterfaceDirection.name: rlPolicyRulesInterfaceDirection
rlPolicyRulesInterfaceDirection.description: Specifies the direction for this entry on the interface. 'inbound' traffic is operated on during receipt, while 'outbound' traffic is operated on prior to transmission. Based on the metering support: inbound available while the ingress metering supported, outbound available while egress metering supported, and none while no metering supported.

rlPolicyRulesFilteringAction.name: rlPolicyRulesFilteringAction
rlPolicyRulesFilteringAction.description: Specifies the action for the filter. Values 1-10 reserved for the System filtering implemetation; Values starting from 11 may be used for user definition about future application.

rlPolicyRulesDroppedPackets.name: rlPolicyRulesDroppedPackets
rlPolicyRulesDroppedPackets.description: The number of packets blocked by this filtering rule.

rlPolicyRulesFurtherRefPointer.name: rlPolicyRulesFurtherRefPointer
rlPolicyRulesFurtherRefPointer.description: This further reference indicate on the entry at the metering or action table, based on the supported features. The rlPolicyRulesFurtherRefPointer points on the metering table if the metering feature is supported, if not this fields points on the Action table

rlPolicyRulesDescription.name: rlPolicyRulesDescription
rlPolicyRulesDescription.description: Free text specifing the nature of this Rule.

rlPolicyRulesStatus.name: rlPolicyRulesStatus
rlPolicyRulesStatus.description: Row status of the Rules entry.

rlPolicyRulesCounterIdx.name: rlPolicyRulesCounterIdx
rlPolicyRulesCounterIdx.description: If not zero, perform counting of matched packets .

rlPolicyRulesCounter.name: rlPolicyRulesCounter
rlPolicyRulesCounter.description: The number of packets that matched this filtering rule.

rlPolicyRulesActionPointer.name: rlPolicyRulesActionPointer
rlPolicyRulesActionPointer.description: This further reference indicate on the entry at the action table, The rlPolicyRulesActionPointer points on the action table if the aggregate metering feature is supported,or if meter is not belong to data path.

rlPolicyRulesTimeRange1.name: rlPolicyRulesTimeRange1
rlPolicyRulesTimeRange1.description: Time range of the first ACL.

rlPolicyRulesTimeRange2.name: rlPolicyRulesTimeRange2
rlPolicyRulesTimeRange2.description: Time range of the second ACL.

rlPolicyRulesSrcPortRangeStart.name: rlPolicyRulesSrcPortRangeStart
rlPolicyRulesSrcPortRangeStart.description: Start port of port range for source port.

rlPolicyRulesSrcPortRangeEnd.name: rlPolicyRulesSrcPortRangeEnd
rlPolicyRulesSrcPortRangeEnd.description: End port of port range for source port.

rlPolicyRulesDestPortRangeStart.name: rlPolicyRulesDestPortRangeStart
rlPolicyRulesDestPortRangeStart.description: Start port of port range for destination port.

rlPolicyRulesDestPortRangeEnd.name: rlPolicyRulesDestPortRangeEnd
rlPolicyRulesDestPortRangeEnd.description: End port of port range for destination port.

rlPolicyRulesActionDropType.name: rlPolicyRulesActionDropType
rlPolicyRulesActionDropType.description: This field is valid only if rlPolicyRulesFilteringAction is not permit. Used to distinguish between Hard and Soft drop.

rlPolicyRulesDownloadMarker.name: rlPolicyRulesDownloadMarker
rlPolicyRulesDownloadMarker.description: Indicates when rules download or removing starts and terminates.

rlPolicyMeterDepth.name: rlPolicyMeterDepth
rlPolicyMeterDepth.description: Indicates how many meters can be chained in succession (ie. so that if the first meter fails, the second can be examined). The final meter in a sequence is always 'always-conform', so if the value of this parameter is 2, the platform that supports a single meter and then a second marking/action for meter failure.

rlPolicyMeterClassTable.name: rlPolicyMeterClassTable
rlPolicyMeterClassTable.description: This table defines the Metering classes for the system.

rlPolicyMeteringClassEntry.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassEntry
rlPolicyMeteringClassEntry.description: Each statement consists of the following parameters

rlPolicyMeteringClassAlwaysConform.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassAlwaysConform
rlPolicyMeteringClassAlwaysConform.description: If true, the meter always accepts all traffic; its rate is effectively infinite. In such a case, the token bucket defined by the MeterRate and Burst-Size parameters is ignored. also used when there isn't metering support.

rlPolicyMeteringClassAggregateMeterRate.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassAggregateMeterRate
rlPolicyMeteringClassAggregateMeterRate.description: The rate in kilobytes/second of traffic considered within the bandwidth allocated for this policy entry.

rlPolicyMeteringClassAggregateMeterBurst.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassAggregateMeterBurstSize
rlPolicyMeteringClassAggregateMeterBurst.description: The Burst Size parameter for the aggregate meter leaky bucket. A value of 0 means that the device should choose the Burst Size that it thinks is most suitable for the rule. The interval can be derived from (burstSizex8/Rate).

rlPolicyMeteringClassPerSessionMeteringR.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassPerSessionMeteringRate
rlPolicyMeteringClassPerSessionMeteringR.description: A Quantitative Appliction policy rule where each individual session requires a guaranteed minimum bandwidth. Specifies the Ingress traffic flow meter per session indicate a bandwidth limit to be applied to each individual session Value 0 at rlPolicyMeteringClassPerSessionMetering and rlPolicyMeteringClassMaxSessionLimit is interpreted to mean no sepecific requarment and the aggregate metering will be done by the system decision. The rate in kilobytes/second

rlPolicyMeteringClassMaxSessionLimit.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassMaxSessionLimit
rlPolicyMeteringClassMaxSessionLimit.description: indicate a the maximum number of session for a sepecific rule to guarante minimum bandwidth. Value 0 at rlPolicyMeteringClassPerSessionMetering and rlPolicyMeteringClassMaxSessionLimit is interpreted to mean no sepecific requarment and the aggregate metering will be done by the system decision.

rlPolicyMeteringClassActionPointer.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassActionPointer
rlPolicyMeteringClassActionPointer.description: Specifies the index in the rlPolicyActionTable to be accessed for packets that are in-profile. Value 0 is interpreted to mean no action. A non-zero value may be specified only for RoutedIp packets in Diffserv mode.

rlPolicyMeteringClassFailMeterPointer.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassFailMeterPointer
rlPolicyMeteringClassFailMeterPointer.description: Specifies an index in the rlPolicyMeterClassTable. This is the meter that is to be used if the packet is out-of-profile relative to the current meter. If non-Diffserv mode, this field is not used. If the current meter is AlwaysConform, this field is not used.

rlPolicyMeteringClassStatus.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassStatus
rlPolicyMeteringClassStatus.description: The status of a table entry. It is used to delete an entry from this table.

rlPolicyMeteringCounterEnable.name: rlPolicyMeteringCounterEnable
rlPolicyMeteringCounterEnable.description: Enable metering counter for the meter entry.

rlPolicyMeteringClassInProfileCounter.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassInProfileCounter
rlPolicyMeteringClassInProfileCounter.description: meter counter for packets that are in profile .

rlPolicyMeteringClassOutProfileCounter.name: rlPolicyMeteringClassOutProfileCounter
rlPolicyMeteringClassOutProfileCounter.description: meter counter for packets that are out of profile

rlPolicyActionMREDSupported.name: rlPolicyActionMREDSupported
rlPolicyActionMREDSupported.description: Indicates whether the platform supports setting MRED characteristics in the packet action

rlPolicyActionDroppedPacketCountSupporte.name: rlPolicyActionDroppedPacketCountSupported
rlPolicyActionDroppedPacketCountSupporte.description: Indicates whether the platform can maintain a count of packets Marked for drop by a particular action.

rlPolicyActionDroppedDropPrecedenceSuppo.name: rlPolicyActionDroppedDropPrecedenceSupported
rlPolicyActionDroppedDropPrecedenceSuppo.description: Indicates whether the platform support at drop precedence.

rlPolicyActionInProfileDropPrecedence.name: rlPolicyActionInProfileDropPrecedence
rlPolicyActionInProfileDropPrecedence.description: A bit mask indicating which drop precedence supported ---------- |87654321| ---------- 1 - low, 2 - medium, 3 - high, 4 - drop

rlPolicyActionOutProfileDropPrecedence.name: rlPolicyActionOutProfileDropPrecedence
rlPolicyActionOutProfileDropPrecedence.description: A bit mask indicating which drop precedence supported ---------- |87654321| ---------- 1 - low, 2 - medium, 3 - high, 4 - drop

rlPolicyActionDscpSupport.name: rlPolicyActionDscpSupport
rlPolicyActionDscpSupport.description: Indicates whether the platform support at DSCP filed modification.

rlPolicyActionDsQueueManagmentSupported.name: rlPolicyActionDsQueueManagmentSupported
rlPolicyActionDsQueueManagmentSupported.description: Indicates whether the platform supports at Q managment for implementation, mred, randomDrop used by the min/max threshold

rlPolicyActionTable.name: rlPolicyActionTable
rlPolicyActionTable.description: This table defines the Actions for packets that pass the meter table ie. the characteristics that are assigned to packets before they reach the scheduler. When Diffserv is not in effect(ie. IPX, bridging, or IP when the global option for Diffserv is off), certain table parameters are not available(see below). The DiffServ option is enabled or disabled by setting rlDiffservModeEnabled.

rlPolicyActionEntry.name: rlPolicyActionEntry
rlPolicyActionEntry.description: Each multifield classification statement consists of the following parameters

rlPolicyActionNewDscp.name: rlPolicyActionNewDscp
rlPolicyActionNewDscp.description: Indicates the new DSCP with which the packet should be marked

rlPolicyActionChangeDscp.name: rlPolicyActionChangeDscp
rlPolicyActionChangeDscp.description: If true, the packet is re-marked with the value indicated by newDscp above. If false, the packet's DSCP value is not changed

rlPolicyActionMinThreshold.name: rlPolicyActionMinThreshold
rlPolicyActionMinThreshold.description: The min-threshold is the queue depth that a random drop process will seek to manage the queue's depth to. This object is in the action table rather than the queue table because Differentiated Services PHBs, such as the Assured Service, permit differently classified traffic to have different drop parameters even though they occupy the same queue.

rlPolicyActionMaxThreshold.name: rlPolicyActionMaxThreshold
rlPolicyActionMaxThreshold.description: The max-threshold is the maximum permissible queue depth. In tail drop scenarios, the queue will drop if a packet is presented to it and it is instantaneously full by this measure. In random drop scenarios, the queue will drop if a packet is presented to it and the average queue depth exceeds the max-threshold. This object is in the action table rather than the queue table because Differentiated Services PHBs, such as the Assured Service, permit differently classified traffic to have different drop parameters even though they occupy the same queue.

rlPolicyActionDroppedPackets.name: rlPolicyActionDroppedPackets
rlPolicyActionDroppedPackets.description: The number of packets dropped by this action

rlPolicyActionNonDsInProfileDropPreceden.name: rlPolicyActionNonDsInProfileDropPrecedence
rlPolicyActionNonDsInProfileDropPreceden.description: This paramer is used at non diffserv mode to attached the drop precedence for packet InProfile (metering), only if there is a support for drop precedence and with what level.

rlPolicyActionNonDsOutProfileDropPrecede.name: rlPolicyActionNonDsOutProfileDropPrecedence
rlPolicyActionNonDsOutProfileDropPrecede.description: This paramer is used at non diffserv mode to attached the drop precedence for packet OutProfile (metering), only if there is a support for drop precedence and with what level.

rlPolicyActionChangeVpt.name: rlPolicyActionChangeVpt
rlPolicyActionChangeVpt.description: Routed packets that run through the Rules receive VPT as define at the service class they attached to, bridge packets receive through the 802.1p operation unless we define to change the VPT for those packets.

rlPolicyActionNewVpt.name: rlPolicyActionNewVpt
rlPolicyActionNewVpt.description: Priority Tag that will be written to packets .

rlPolicyActionServiceClassPointer.name: rlPolicyActionServiceClassPointer
rlPolicyActionServiceClassPointer.description: Specifies the index in rlPolicyServiceClassTable denoting the service class to which the packet should be assigned after the action specified in this entry is carried out. A value of 0 means that no Service class is assigned. A value of 0 is legal only for routedIp packets in Diffserv mode on Inbound processing.

rlPolicyActionStatus.name: rlPolicyActionStatus
rlPolicyActionStatus.description: The status of the table entry

rlPolicyActionChangeDscpNonConform.name: rlPolicyActionChangeDscpNonConform
rlPolicyActionChangeDscpNonConform.description: If true, the packet is re-marked with the value indicated by newDscp for non conforming packets. If false, the packet's DSCP value is not changed

rlPolicyActionChangeNewDscpNonConform.name: rlPolicyActionChangeNewDscpNonConform
rlPolicyActionChangeNewDscpNonConform.description: Indicates the new DSCP with which the packet should be marked

rlPolicyActionAdvancedTrustMode.name: rlPolicyActionAdvancedTrustMode
rlPolicyActionAdvancedTrustMode.description: Indicates if egress queue is assigned for packets match rule according to global trust mode or note.

rlPolicyActionNewIpPrecedence.name: rlPolicyActionNewIpPrecedence
rlPolicyActionNewIpPrecedence.description: Indicates the new Ip- Precedence with which the packet should be marked

rlPolicyActionChangeIpPrecedence.name: rlPolicyActionChangeIpPrecedence
rlPolicyActionChangeIpPrecedence.description: If true, the packet is re-marked with the value indicated by newIpPrecedence above. If false, the packet's DSCP value is not changed

rlPolicyActionNewInterface.name: rlPolicyActionNewInterface
rlPolicyActionNewInterface.description: Relevant if rlQosClassMapRedirect is either 'redirectToInterface' or 'analyzerPort'. Specified the output interface the packet is redireted to or the port that gets copy of the packet in addition to the port it was farwarded.

rlPolicyActionChangeVidAction.name: rlPolicyActionChangeVidAction
rlPolicyActionChangeVidAction.description: If 'mark', than the classified traffic will be remarked with new VLAN id. If 'disabled' VLAN id is not changed. If markNestedVlan, if the egress interface defined as VLAN tagged member then a new VLAN tag is added to the packet.

rlPolicyActionNewVid.name: rlPolicyActionNewVid
rlPolicyActionNewVid.description: If rlPolicyActionChangeVid is true, specify the new Vlan id to assigned to the packet

rlPolicyActionTrapTypeId.name: rlPolicyActionTrapTypeId
rlPolicyActionTrapTypeId.description: If now zero, Indicates the trap type id the matched packets arrives with, relevant when RedirectAction is trap or mirror.

rlPolicyActionAddTunnel.name: rlPolicyActionAddTunnel
rlPolicyActionAddTunnel.description: If not zero - Tunnel is added to matched packets.

rlPolicyNumberOfServiceClassesSupported.name: rlPolicyNumberOfServiceClassesSupported
rlPolicyNumberOfServiceClassesSupported.description: Indicates the number of service classes supported on each port of the platform. Service classes can be neither created nor destroyed.

rlPolicyBoundedPriorityQueueSupport.name: rlPolicyBoundedPriorityQueueSupport
rlPolicyBoundedPriorityQueueSupport.description: Indicates whether the platform supports setting an upper limit to the bandwidth of traffic transmitted on queues operating in Strict Priority mode.

rlPolicyDefaultServiceClass.name: rlPolicyDefaultServiceClass
rlPolicyDefaultServiceClass.description: Indicates which service class is default one for packets whose COS is undetermined.

rlPolicyActiveServiceClassTable.name: rlPolicyActiveServiceClassTable
rlPolicyActiveServiceClassTable.description: Specifies the Service Class table preform active action (usuarlly after set of entries at the service class tentative table). Specifies the current status of a table, there could be two options, tentative/active table. only the tentative table is the read-write and the active table is read-only. at set to activeAction the tentative table will be copied to the active table.

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTable.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTable
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTable.description: This table defines the service classes for the system ie. the queue discipline and weight characteristics that are implemented on each port unless the user configures a port specific value in .... The total number of service classes defined can not exceed rlPolicyNumberOfTransmitQueuesPerPort.

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeEntry.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeEntry
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeEntry.description: Each multifield classification statement consists of the following parameters

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeIndex.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeIndex
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeIndex.description: This enumerates the ServiceClass Tentative entry.

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeName.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeName
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeName.description: The name given by the system administrator to the class.

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativePhbType.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativePhbType
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativePhbType.description: Indicates the type of Diffserv per-hop behaviour that this service class is intended to support. This object can be set by the user only in DiffServ mode (i.e. rlDiffservModeEnabled = enabled).

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeMinRate.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeMinRate
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeMinRate.description: Specifies either the minimum throughput of the queue as a percentage of the throughput of each output port on which the service class is implemented. If zero, there is no minimum rate. This field can not be set by the user if rlDiffservModeEnabled = disabled and rlPolicyServiceClassPriority > 0 or rlDiffservModeEnabled = enabled and rlPolicyServiceClassPhbType = expeditedForwarding.

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeMaxRate.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeMaxRate
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeMaxRate.description: Specifies either the upper limit on the throughput of the queue as a percentage of the throughput of each output port on which the service class is implemented. If zero, there is no maximum rate. This field can not be set by the user if rlDiffservModeEnabled = disabled and rlPolicyServiceClassPriority = 0 or rlDiffservModeEnabled = enabled and rlPolicyServiceClassPhbType != expeditedForwarding or rlBoundedPriorityQueueSupport = notSupported.

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativePriority.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativePriority
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativePriority.description: If non-zero, this service class will operate as a priority service class with the specified priority value. This object can not be set in Diffserv mode (i.e. rlDiffservModeEnabled = enabled), in which case rlServiceClassPhbType should be used instead. It can't be set when rlBoundedPriorityQueueSupport = notSupported as well.

rlPolicyServiceClassTentative8021DPri.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentative8021DPri
rlPolicyServiceClassTentative8021DPri.description: 802.1D Priority Tag that will be written to routed packets and untagged bridged packets transmitted with this service class.

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTdThershold.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTdThersholdDp0
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTdThershold.description: Tail Drop Threshold for Drop Precedence 0. UNITS percent 0-100

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTdThershold.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTdThersholdDp1
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTdThershold.description: Tail Drop Threshold for Drop Precedence 1. UNITS percent 0-100

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTdThershold.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTdThersholdDp2
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeTdThershold.description: Tail Drop Threshold for Drop Precedence 2. UNITS percent 0-100

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMinDp0.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMinDp0
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMinDp0.description: WRED Min Threshold for Drop Precedence 0. UNITS percent 0-100

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMaxDp0.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMaxDp0
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMaxDp0.description: WRED Max Threshold for Drop Precedence 0. UNITS percent 0-100

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMinDp1.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMinDp1
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMinDp1.description: WRED Min Threshold for Drop Precedence 1. UNITS percent 0-100

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMaxDp1.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMaxDp1
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMaxDp1.description: WRED Max Threshold for Drop Precedence 1. UNITS percent 0-100

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMinDp2.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMinDp2
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMinDp2.description: WRED Min Threshold for Drop Precedence 2. UNITS percent 0-100

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMaxDp2.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMaxDp2
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedMaxDp2.description: WRED Max Threshold for Drop Precedence 2. UNITS percent 0-100

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedQweight.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedQweight
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeRedQweight.description: additional parameter for the WRED algorithem supporting the Queue weight exponentail factor

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeShaperStatu.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeShaperStatus
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeShaperStatu.description: If there is shaper on the Queue

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeCirQueueSha.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeCirQueueShaper
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeCirQueueSha.description: The CIR for the Queue shaper. N/A when the shper is disabled. UNITS bps bits per second

rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeCbsQueueSha.name: rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeCbsQueueShaper
rlPolicyServiceClassTentativeCbsQueueSha.description: The CBS for the Queue shaper. N/A when the shper is disabled. UNITS bytes

rlPolicyServiceClassActiveTable.description: This table defines the service classes for the system ie. the queue discipline and weight characteristics that are implemented on each port unless the user configures a port specific value in .... The total number of service classes defined can not exceed rlPolicyNumberOfTransmitQueuesPerPort.

This object can not be set in Diffserv mode (i.e. rlDiffservModeEnabled = enabled), in which case rlServiceClassPhbType should be used instead. It can't be set when rlBoundedPriorityQueueSupport = notSupported as well.

rlPolicyPortCfgMinimalBandwidth.name: rlPolicyPortCfgMinimalBandwidth
rlPolicyPortCfgMinimalBandwidth.description: The list of objects contain parameters at Precents type for the minimal bandwidth to this port/service class at WWR . The OID length is based on the number of the service class number, every OID define parameter of service class.

rlPolicyPortCfgMaximalBandwidth.name: rlPolicyPortCfgMaximalBandwidth

rlpolicyDropProfilePointer.name: rlpolicyDropProfilePointer
rlpolicyDropProfilePointer.description: pointing to drop algorithem profile. the profile describs the drop algorithem (tail, red)and params

rlPolicyPortCfgQueueShaperStatus.name: rlPolicyPortCfgQueueShaperStatus
